Articles.Content:
When uploading many images to Imgur to go into an album, the limited sort options make it hard to get all images in the correct order.

One such option is to sort by original filename.

The problem arises due to Imgur putting screenshot74.png after screenshot102.png due to alphabetical sorting.

My suggestion is to put leading zeroes so that all images up to screenshot9999.png will all be in alphabetical order when looking at the filename.

e.g. screenshot0004.png

screenshot0034.png

screenshot0234.png

screenshot1234.png

This would greatly ease the management of large amounts of screenshots and making albums

Does anyone have more than 9999 screenshots?

Maybe extra leading zeroes might be in order if that is the case.

I prefer what Sensible Screenshots does: Date/time in the filename. No need of leading zeroes, no screwups when you delete the 5th-8th screenshot and take an 18th screenshot that gets named "5". No wondering when you took the screenshots. This is what I want stock to do.

Digital cameras have done it since... ever. KSP should too.
Even better - screenshot2015-09-27-134645.png. Sorts them by time and date, conforming to ISO 8601, which means no limits. Basically, make Sensible Screenshot stock pls

$RealTimestamp-$Savename-$SaveTimestamp.png

I like this particular option very much.

$RealTimestamp-$Savename-$SaveTimestamp.png

I support this idea. For file sorting purposes the timestamps should be in descending resolution order (YYYYMMDD).

$RealTimestamp-$Savename-$SaveTimestamp.png

Yup. This option would be perfect.
